sentences.title: FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The FIFA World Cup, often called the World Cup, is an international association football competition among the senior men's national teams of the members of the Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA), the sport's global governing body.

sentences.title: FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The tournament has been held every four years since the inaugural tournament in 1930, with the exception of 1942 and 1946 due to the Second World War.

sentences.title: FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The reigning champions are Argentina, who won their third title at the 2022 World Cup by defeating France.

sentences.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2026 FIFA World Cup, marketed as FIFA World Cup 26, will be the 23rd FIFA World Cup, the quadrennial international men's soccer championship contested by the national teams of the member associations of FIFA.

sentences.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The tournament will take place from June 11 to July 19, 2026.

sentences.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It will be jointly hosted by sixteen cities—eleven in the United States, three in Mexico, and two in Canada.

sentences.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The tournament will be the first to be hosted by three nations.

sentences.title: List of FIFA World Cup finals
sentences.sentence_text: The FIFA World Cup is an international association football competition contested by the senior men's national teams of the Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA), the sport's global governing body.

sentences.title: List of FIFA World Cup finals
sentences.sentence_text: The championship has been awarded every four years since 1930, except in 1942 and 1946, when it was not held because of World War II.

sentences.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2022 FIFA World Cup was the 22nd FIFA World Cup, the quadrennial world championship for national football teams organised by FIFA.

sentences.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It took place in Qatar from 20 November to 18 December 2022, after the country was awarded the hosting rights in 2010.

sentences.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It was the first World Cup to be held in the Middle East and the Arabian Peninsula, and the second in an Asian country after the 2002 tournament in South Korea and Japan.

sentences.title: 2018 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2018 FIFA World Cup was the 21st FIFA World Cup, the quadrennial world championship for national football teams organised by FIFA.

sentences.title: 2018 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It took place in Russia from 14 June to 15 July 2018, after the country was awarded the hosting rights in late 2010.

sentences.title: 2018 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It was the eleventh time the championships had been held in Europe and the first time they were held in Eastern Europe, also featuring one or two venues, depending on definition, located across the boundary with Asia.

sentences.title: 2018 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: At an estimated cost of over $14.2 billion, it was the most expensive World Cup ever held until it was surpassed by the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

sentences.title: 2030 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2030 FIFA World Cup will be the 24th FIFA World Cup, a quadrennial international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA.

sentences.title: 2010 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2010 FIFA World Cup was the 19th FIFA World Cup, the world championship for men's national football teams.

sentences.title: 2010 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It took place in South Africa from 11 June to 11 July 2010.

sentences.title: 2010 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The bidding process for hosting the tournament finals was open only to African nations.

sentences.title: 2010 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: In 2004, the international football federation, FIFA, selected South Africa over Egypt and Morocco to become the first African nation to host the finals.

sentences.title: 1994 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 1994 FIFA World Cup was the 15th FIFA World Cup, the world championship for men's national soccer teams.

sentences.title: 1994 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It was hosted by the United States and took place from June 17 to July 17, 1994, at nine venues across the country.

sentences.title: 1994 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The United States was chosen as the host by FIFA on July 4, 1988.

sentences.title: 1994 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: Despite soccer's relative lack of popularity in the host nation, the tournament was the most financially successful in World Cup history.

sentences.title: 1994 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It broke tournament records with overall attendance of 3,587,538 and an average of 68,991 per game, figures that stand unsurpassed as of 2022, despite the expansion of the competition from 24 to 32 teams starting with the 1998 World Cup.

sentences.title: 2006 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: The 2006 FIFA World Cup was the 18th FIFA World Cup, the quadrennial international football world championship tournament.

sentences.title: 2006 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It was held from 9 June to 9 July 2006 in Germany, which had won the right to host the event in July 2000.

sentences.title: 2006 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: Teams representing 198 national football associations from all six populated continents participated in the qualification process which began in September 2003.

sentences.title: 2006 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: Thirty-one teams qualified from this process along with hosts Germany for the finals tournament.

sentences.title: 2006 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It was the second time that Germany staged the competition and the first as a unified country along with the former East Germany with Leipzig as a host city, and the 10th time that the tournament was held in Europe.

sentences.title: 2014 FIFA World Cup
sentences.sentence_text: It took place in Brazil from 12 June to 13 July 2014, after the country was awarded the hosting rights in 2007.

sentences.title: 2014 FIFA World Cup

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: Recently, football has seen the creation of various novel, ubiquitous metrics used throughout clubs’ analytics departments.

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: These can influence many of their day-to-day operations ranging from financial decisions on player transfers, to evaluation of team performance.

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: At the forefront of this scientific movement is the metric expected goals , a measure which allows analysts to quantify how likely a given shot is to result in a goal however, xG models have not until this point considered using important features, e.g., player/team ability and psychological effects, and is not widely trusted by everyone in the wider football community.

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: This study aims to solve both these issues through the implementation of machine learning techniques by, modelling expected goals values using previously untested features and comparing the predictive ability of traditional statistics against this newly developed metric.

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: Error values from the expected goals models built in this work were shown to be competitive with optimal values from other papers, and some of the features added in this study were revealed to have a significant impact on expected goals model outputs.

sentences.title: Expected goals in football: Improving model performance and demonstrating value
sentences.sentence_text: Secondly, not only was expected goals found to be a superior predictor of a football team’s future success when compared to traditional statistics, but also our results outperformed those collected from an industry leader in the same area.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: This article is about the relationship between football and religion.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: It focuses on the recent proliferation of neo-Pentecostalism among Brazilian football players living abroad and the importance of religion in their daily lives.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: Serving as a civilizing device that promotes better insertion of individuals in modern institutions, neo-Pentecostalism promotes voluntary obedience, self-control, self-awareness and reflexivity, by encouraging the conscious and constant monitoring of the individual over the body and emotions.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: This self-discipline has a limit, and the Theology of Prosperity offers conciliation between asceticism and material consumption.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: Football provides religion a large stage for its preaching, allowing it to reach billions of homes.

sentences.title: Banal religiosity: Brazilian athletes as new missionaries of the neo-Pentecostal diaspora
sentences.sentence_text: The athletes become "selfless soldiers of the Word," who demonstrate the faith globally and disseminate banal religion through the mediascape.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Abstract.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: The aim of this theoretical review is to summarize the key performance indicators and contextual variables that have been related to goal scoring in soccer, as well as to discuss the new perspectives and future challenges for the development of research studies on this topic.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Firstly, situational variables such as match location, time of the game, opponent level, as well as match status have been shown to have an influence on goal scoring.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Secondly, tactical factors such as the team possession type of start, starting zone, initial opponent positioning, type of attack, pass number per possession, type of assist, finishing zone and type of finishing have been described as performance indicators related to goal scoring in professional soccer.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: During the past, the vast majority of studies analysed tactical or technical indicators isolated from the complex and multifactorial process of creating goal scoring situations.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Currently, the emergence of new research methods such as position data, network analysis, temporal patterns or mixed methods has broadened the possibilities for researchers to capture the complexity of soccer actions and interactions.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Thus, some future challenges in the analysis of goal scoring in soccer should explore: a) the multidimensional evaluation of shooting effectiveness, b) the goal effectiveness of different styles of play, c) the goal-scorer’s skills, d) the further exploration of the effect of players interactions on goal scoring, e) f) the effects of training methods on goal scoring and f) the influence of contextual variables on goal scoring actions.Resumen.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: El objetivo de esta revisión teórica es sintetizar los principales indicadores de rendimiento y variables contextuales que han sido relacionados con marcar goles en fútbol, así como discutir nuevas perspectivas y futuros retos en el desarrollo de estudios científicos sobre este tema.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: En primer lugar, variables contextuales como localización del partido, tiempo de juego, nivel del oponente y marcador han mostrado una influencia en el proceso de marcar goles.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: En segundo lugar, indicadores tácticos como el tipo de inicio de la posesión ofensiva, la zona de inicio, el posicionamiento inicial del equipo rival, el tipo de ataque, el número de pases por posesión, el tipo de asistencia, la zona de finalización y el tipo de finalización han sido descritos en la literatura relacionada con el análisis del gol en fútbol.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Sin embargo, la gran mayoría de estudios han analizado indicadores tácticos y técnicos aislados del proceso complejo y multifactorial que supone generar situaciones de gol.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: En los últimos años, han surgido nuevas metodologías de investigación como el “position data”, “análisis de redes”, “análisis de patrones temporales” y “métodos mixtos” que han aumentado las posibilidades de capturar e investigar la complejidad de las acciones e interacciones del juego en fútbol.

sentences.title: Past, present and future of goal scoring analysis in professional soccer (Pasado, presente y futuro del análisis de goles en el fútbol profesional)
sentences.sentence_text: Por lo tanto, algunos de los retos de futuros estudios sobre análisis de los goles en fútbol deberían explorar: a) la evaluación multidimensional de la efectividad del tiro en fútbol, b) la efectividad para marcar gol de diferentes estilos de juego, c) las habilidades especificas de los goleadores, d) la mayor exploración del efecto de las interacciones entre jugadores en la generación de situaciones de gol, e) los efectos del entrenamiento en la capacidad de marcar goles y f) la influencia de las variables contextuales en las acciones relacionadas con los goles.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: Association football (soccer) is the most popular sport in the world, resulting in a large economic interest from investors, team managers, and betting agencies.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: For this reason, a vast number of rating systems exists to assess the strength of football teams or individual players.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: Nevertheless, most of the existing approaches incorporate deficiencies, e. g., that they depend on subjective ratings from experts.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: The objective of this work was the development of a new rating system for determining the playing strength of football players.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: The Elo algorithm, which has established itself as an objective and adaptive rating system in numerous individual sports, has been expanded in accordance with the requirements of team sports.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: Matches from 16 different European domestic leagues, the UEFA Champions and Europa Leagues have been recorded, with more than 17 000 matches played in recent years, and 12 400 different players.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: The developed rating system produced promising results, when evaluating the matches based on its predictions.

sentences.title: A football player rating system
sentences.sentence_text: A high relevance of the created system results from the fact that only the associated match report is needed and thus—in relation to existing valuation models—significantly more football players can be assessed.

sentences.sentence_text: In order to achieve a more successful output in terms of more transparent and professional progress of the process, the MAXQDA program was preferred.

sentences.sentence_text: This research was structured in two sections.

sentences.sentence_text: The completion of the codes created in the consensus, took place in a total of four months.

sentences.sentence_text: The analysis was visualized, and the code frequencies were added using the "MAXMaps Hierarchical Code-Subcode Model" option on the "visual tools" tab of the program.

sentences.title: Mainstreamed and Marginalized: Female Athletes as the “Other” in International Sport Media Coverage
sentences.sentence_text: Western media critics have long observed that female athletes seldom receive more than a minimal amount of media coverage devoted to sport, due in large part to the masculine hegemony that pervades the sport industry.In the US and other Western countries, men's sports are overwhelmingly privileged in nearly all media contexts.Consequently, female athletes have been accustomed to being marginalized, sexualized, and, in some cases, rendered invisible by media outlets as they are situated as the "Other" in the press.According to feminist critics, sport normalizes men's power, as evidenced by the media's tendency to highlight women's physical attractiveness and marital status rather than their athletic skills.Increasingly, male privilege and bias are manifested through commentary intended to differentiate men's and women's sports rather than through blatant gendered stereotypes.The picture is not entirely bleak, however, with some increased media attention devoted to women's sports in audience-driven televised events like the Olympics, the World Cup, and professional tennis and golf tournaments; however, these are the exceptions.This article explores the sometimes paradoxical relationship between women's sport and "Otherness," whereby women can be both mainstreamed and marginalized in contemporary popular media.

sentences.title: The association between Saudi football clubs and the loyalty of their fanbase, a cross-sectional study.

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: The purpose of this study was to investigate the nation branding process deployed by a host country organizing committee.

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: Three research questions helped guide this study: (1) How does the organizing committee see the opportunity of hosting a sport-mega event (SME) as a nation branding tool?

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: (2) What aspects of the FIFA World Cup (FWC) do people working with the organizing committee believe, create such nation branding opportunities?

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: (3) How do event organizers leverage a nation branding legacy from the FWC?

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: A single case study was built using 1,669 document pages, and nine semi-structured interviews and data were thematically analyzed.

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: The study investigated relevant organizational documents and the event organizers’ perspectives to determine the nation branding processes.

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: Results revealed the organization's approach to nation branding involved assessing their external image, creating a country narrative based on the population's characteristics and values, and depicting a unique identity by showcasing their cultural heritage to increase the attraction of the nation brand.

sentences.title: Nation Branding Through a Mega-Event: A Case Study of Qatar 2022
sentences.sentence_text: Findings highlight that nation branding through the FWC requires the LOC’s strategic coordination through nation brand stakeholders, nation brand ambassadors, important organizations as well as the leadership of the nation in order to build brand equity.
